title: A Coven of Witches
description: Beware a girl in pointy shoesA girl wearing pointy shoes might be a witch. And the first thing a spook's apprentice learns is never, ever to trust a witch.In this bone-chilling collection of tales, you will learn exactly why that is, as you encounter:a fair and beautiful woman with green scales running down her spine . . . (John Gregory, set before book 1, book 0.7)a dead witch who lurks under rotting leaves and hunts for blood . . . (not bound to any patricular book)Alice, Tom Ward's best friend, who once lived with one of the darkest witches of all . . . (set slightly before book one but best read after book one, book 1.1)and a witch whose cry of revenge can kill. (Banshee Witch, set chronologicly as book 5.5)The dark is all around. Who will survive?_________Separate tales reveal the backgrounds of four terrifying witches, including Alice and the Spook's love, Meg.
author: Joseph  Delaney
